page.title: 07SHEPHERDING WARDLOW
page.content: {Farming Cressbrook Wardlow {SHEEP}are kept at Wardlow by 3 full- time and 4 part time farmers.Suffolk cross sheep are kept for fat lamb production and wool,the latter sold annually to the British wool Marketing Board at Bradford.Permanent grassland grazing is supplemented by hay in winter.During lambing in spring the sheep are housed at night.From August onwards lambs of 17 kilos are marketed Routine tasks are foot-trimming,dosing for intestinal worms and compulsory dipping twice a year for scab and flies.{BUTTS}farm keep 250 sheep on 50 hectares.{HALL}farm keep 500 on 150 hectares including poor pasture and moor land at Wardlow Hay Cop. {BEEF}Three cows are kept at{BUTTS}farm to bucket rear 8 calves per cow per year.The others suckle 2 calves each. The calves are sold at 18-24 months.
